summary: Palliative care is a special kind of medical care that helps people with serious illnesses live as comfortably as possible. It's about easing pain, suffering, and other problems that come with life-threatening diseases. This care isn't just for end-of-life situations; it can start as soon as someone is diagnosed with a serious illness. A team of doctors, nurses, therapists, and other experts works together to improve patients' quality of life, addressing physical, emotional, and spiritual needs. This care can happen in hospitals, at home, or in other settings.
title: Palliative care
